cat.lump.ir.sim.ml.esa

Class SimilarityESA

  • java.lang.Object
    • cat.lump.ir.sim.ml.esa.Esa
      • cat.lump.ir.sim.ml.esa.SimilarityESA
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Similarity
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimilarityCLESA, SimilarityESAdocs, SimilarityESAlines

    public abstract class SimilarityESA
extends Esa
    Implementation of Explicit Semantic Analysis as described in:
    Gabrilovich, Evgeniy, and Shaul Markovitch. "Computing Semantic Relatedness Using Wikipedia-based Explicit Semantic Analysis". 1606â€“1611. Hyderabad, India, 2007.

    For this version the inverted index is based on Lucene.
    In brief, the process is as follows. Given two documents d1 and d2:
    • query d1 (d2) to the previously generated index (with LuceneIndexer)
    • retrieve and normalize the resulting relevance vectors for d1 (d2)
    • compute the cosine similarity between the vector representations d1 and d2
    Since:
    April 18 2012
    Version:
    0.2.1
    Author:
    albarron
    See Also:
    cat.lump.ir.sim.EsaGenerator#

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimilarityESA

        public SimilarityESA(java.lang.String indexPath,
             java.lang.String lan,
             java.lang.Boolean overrideObjects)
        Constructor. It sets the path to the Lucene index, the language of the texts we want to compare and if previously computed ESA vectors should be discarded. If overrideObjects==false, previously-computed vector representations of the texts are looked for in the shape of a Java object file. If it doesn't exists, it will be created and saved for future use. TODO move the parameterization to a properties file
        Parameters:
        indexPath - path to Lucene's index
        lan - language to work with
        overrideObjects - if previously computed vectors will be discarded

      • computeVectors

        protected abstract EsaVectors computeVectors(java.io.File documentsPath,
                        java.lang.String object,
                        java.lang.String set)
                                      throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                             java.io.IOException
        Computes the vectors for the texts in the given set. If a previously computed object exists (and overrideObjects==False), it just loads the previously computed vectors.
        Parameters:
        documentsPath - path to the documents
        object - name of the (previously generated object)
        set - whether we are processing A or B
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • objectExists

        protected boolean objectExists(java.io.File object,
                   java.lang.String id)
        Checks whether the vector-representation object exists. Note that if override_object==True, it will claim no objects exists in order to compute it again.
        Parameters:
        object - object to check
        id - flag to report
        Returns:
        true if exists and override_object==false
